 21  import numpy as np 
 22  from collections import namedtuple

 24  from copy import copy

 28 -class TimeSeries(object): 

 29      """ 
 30      A series of values taken at consecutive points in time. 
 31   
 32      The values may be scalars, column vectors, or L{Quaternion} objects. 
 33   
 34      Each value may have a (co)variance associated with it. 
 35   
 36      Timestamps may be irregularly spaced but must be monotonically increasing. 
 37      """ 
 38   

 39 -    def __init__(self, timestamps=None, values=None, variances=None): 

 40          """ 
 41          Construct time series. 
 42   
 43          A time series can be constructed empty, or with initial values if 
 44          passed to the contstructor. 
 45   
 46          @param timestamps: Times at which values were taken. 
 47          @param values: Either a length N array of scalars or other data types, 
 48              an MxN column vector array, or a length N L{QuaternionArray}. 
 49          @param variances : Variances, either a length N sequence of variances 
 50              for scalar data, a NxMxM sequence of covariances for MxN column 
 51              vector data, or an Nx4x4 sequence of covariances for quaternion 
 52              data. 
 53          """ 
 54          if (timestamps is None) != (values is None): 
 55              raise ValueError, "Both or neither of timestamps and values must be provided" 
 56          self._dtype = None 
 57          self._timestampsArray = None 
 58          self._valuesArray = None 
 59          self._variancesArray = None 
 60          if timestamps is not None: 
 61              assert all(np.diff(timestamps) > 0), "Timestamps must be in order" 
 62              if len(np.shape(values)) == 1: 
 63                  values = list(np.asarray(values)) 
 64              else: 
 65                  values = list(np.asarray(np.hsplit(values, values.shape[-1]))) 
 66              if variances is not None: 
 67                  [self.add(t,v,V) for t,v,V in zip(timestamps, values, variances)] 
 68              else: 
 69                  [self.add(t,v) for t,v in zip(timestamps, values)] 

 70   

 71 -    def __getstate__(self): 

 72          if self._hasVariances: 
 73              return (self.timestamps, self.values, self.variances) 
 74          else: 
 75              return (self.timestamps, self.values, None) 

 76   

 77 -    def __setstate__(self, state): 

 78          self.__init__(*state) 

 79   

 80 -    def __len__(self): 

 81          if self._dtype is None: 
 82              return 0 
 83          else: 
 84              return len(self._timestamps) 

 85   

 86 -    def _initTypes(self, value): 

 87          self._dtype = type(value) 
 88          self._dshape = np.shape(value) 
 89          if isinstance(value, np.ndarray): 
 90              value = np.asarray(value) 
 91              self._dims = value.shape[0] 
 92          elif isinstance(value, Quaternion): 
 93              self._dims = 4 
 94          else: 
 95              self._dims = 1 

 96   

 97 -    def _varianceShape(self): 

 98          if self._dims == 1: 
 99              return () 
100          else: 
101              return (self._dims, self._dims) 

102   
103      @property 

104 -    def dtype(self): 

105          """ 
106          Type of data in this time series. 
107          """ 
108          return self._dtype

111 -    def timestamps(self): 

112          """ 
113          Array of times at which the values were taken. 
114          """ 
115          if self._timestampsArray is None: 
116              self._timestampsArray = np.array(self._timestamps) 
117          return self._timestampsArray 

118   

119 -    def _makeValuesArray(self, values): 

120          if self.dtype is Quaternion: 
121              return QuaternionArray(values) 
122          elif issubclass(self._dtype, np.ndarray) and len(self._dshape) == 2 and self._dshape[1] == 1: 
123              return np.hstack(values) 
124          else: 
125              return np.array(values) 

126   
127      @property 

128 -    def values(self): 

129          """ 
130          Array of values of the time series in chronological order. 
131   
132          The returned array has shape (N) for scalars, shape (n, N) for 
133          vectors, or is a L{QuaternionArray} of length N for quaternions, 
134          where N is the number of values. 
135          """ 
136          if self._valuesArray is None: 
137              self._valuesArray = self._makeValuesArray(self._values) 
138          return self._valuesArray 

139   
140      @property 

141 -    def variances(self): 

142          """ 
143          The (co)variances of the values in chronological order. 
144   
145          The returned array has shape (N) if the values are scalar, 
146          (N, n, n) for vectors, or (N, 4, 4) for quaternions. 
147          """ 
148          if not self._hasVariances: 
149              shape = tuple([len(self)] + list(self._varianceShape())) 
150              variances = np.empty(shape) 
151              variances[:] = np.nan 
152              return variances 
153          if self._variancesArray is None: 
154              self._variancesArray = np.array(self._variances) 
155          return self._variancesArray 

156   

157 -    def __call__(self, t, returnVariance=False): 

158          """ 
159          Obtain the closest previous value to time t. 
160   
161          If returnVariance is True then the value and variance are returned. 
162          """ 
163          indices = np.searchsorted(self.timestamps, t, 'right') - 1 
164          if issubclass(self._dtype, np.ndarray) and len(self._dshape) == 2 and self._dshape[1] == 1: 
165              values = self.values[:,np.atleast_1d(indices)] 
166          else: 
167              values = self.values[indices] 
168          if not returnVariance: 
169              return values 
170          else: 
171              if not self._hasVariances: 
172                  raise ValueError, "This time series has no variance data." 
173              return values, np.array(self._variances[indices]) 

174   

175 -    def __iter__(self): 

176          return itertools.izip(self._timestamps, self._values, self._variances) 

177   

178 -    def add(self, time, value, variance=None): 

179          """ 
180          Add a timestamped value to the data. 
181   
182          @param time: Time at which the value was taken. 
183          @param value: Value to store. The value must support the __copy__ 
184              operation as used by the copy module. 
185          @param variance: (Co)variance of the value. The variance must support 
186              the __copy__ operation as used by the copy module. 
187          """ 
188          if isinstance(value, np.matrix): 
189              value = np.asarray(value) 
190          if np.shape(value) == (1,): 
191              value = value[0] 
192          if self._dtype is None: 
193              self._initTypes(value) 
194              self._timestamps = [time] 
195              self._values = [value] 
196              if variance is not None: 
197                  self._hasVariances = True 
198                  assert np.shape(variance) == self._varianceShape(), \ 
199                          "Variance shape must match series dimensions" 
200                  self._variances = [variance] 
201              else: 
202                  self._hasVariances = False 
203          else: 
204              assert time > self.latestTime, \ 
205                      "Time must be after existing entries" 
206              self._timestamps.append(copy(time)) 
207              assert type(value) == self._dtype, \ 
208                      "Data type must match series data type" 
209              assert np.shape(value) == self._dshape, \ 
210                      "Data shape must match series data shape" 
211              if self._dims > 1 and self._dtype != Quaternion: 
212                  value = np.asarray(value) 
213              self._values.append(copy(value)) 
214              if self._hasVariances: 
215                  assert np.shape(variance) == self._varianceShape(), \ 
216                          "Variance shape must match series dimensions" 
217                  if self._dims > 1: 
218                      variance = np.asarray(variance) 
219                  self._variances.append(copy(variance)) 
220   
221          self._latestTime = time 
222          self._latestValue = value 
223          self._timestampsArray = None 
224          self._valuesArray = None 
225          self._variancesArray = None 

226   
227      @property 

228 -    def earliestTime(self): 

229          """ The earliest time stamp in this time series. """ 
230          return self._timestamps[0] 

231   
232      @property 

233 -    def earliestValue(self): 

234          """ The earliest value in this time series. """ 
235          return self._values[0]

237      @property 

238 -    def latestTime(self): 

239          """ The latest time stamp in this time series. """ 
240          return self._timestamps[-1]

242      @property 

243 -    def latestValue(self): 

244          """ The latest value in this time series. """ 
245          return self._values[-1]
